snippet: The economic forces concentrating more and more wealth into the hands of the fortunate few are almost sure to prevail for a long time, according to a new book by the economist Thomas Piketty.
abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column; economist Thomas Piketty, in his book Capital in the Twenty-First Century, provides analysis of world's economic history that questions core beliefs about market economies; argues that inequality, which many believe will stabilize and subside under free-market capitalism, is likely to get much worse and that economic forces concentrating wealth for fortunate few are almost sure to prevail for very long time.
lead_paragraph: The economic forces concentrating more and more wealth into the hands of the fortunate few are almost sure to prevail for a long time, according to a new book by the economist Thomas Piketty.

headline.main: A Relentless Widening of Disparity in Wealth
